alert.note: Alert for Arthur; Eastern Cherry; Grant; Hooker; McPherson; Thomas; Western Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 29 at 3:42AM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Arthur, southeastern Cherry, southeastern Grant, Hooker, western McPherson and northwestern Thomas Counties through 430 AM CDT/330 AM MDT/... At 342 AM CDT/242 AM MDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 17 miles southwest of Merritt Reservoir to near Arthur. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mullen, Arthur, Seneca, Valentine National Wildlife Refuge, Flatts, Cogill Lake, Marsh Flat, Green Lake, Bucktail Lake, Three Mile Lake, Sevenmile Hill, Kelso, Carr Lake, Highway 97 crossing the North Loup River, Haythorn Lake, Lena, Sand Puddin Lake, Big Lamunyon Flats, McKeag and East Cody Lake. This includes the following highways... Highway 2 between mile markers 163 and 196. Highway 61 between mile markers 112 and 131. Highway 92 between mile markers 165 and 194. Highway 97 between mile markers 48 and 109. Highway 83 between mile markers 183 and 194. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Arthur; Eastern Cherry; Grant; Hooker; McPherson; Thomas; Western Cherry
